channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple potholes and dreadful road surface, 9th February
item.description:
Deteriorating road surface, undermining, and interconnected multiple potholes, both carriageways especially between Bishops Avenue and entrance to Heath at Hampstead Viewpoint. Dangerous to cycle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hampstead Lane, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping at our pub bin area, 9th February
item.description:
People are leaving furniture & bulky rubbish at our pub bins area. The Three Compasses E8 1NH. Our bins are overflowing too, as people dump their rubbish. Please can this be cleared ASAP, but also what can be done to prevent this? Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large quantity of rubbish dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17, 9th February
item.description:
A large quantity of rubbish in bags and loose has been dumped by the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 bus stop, approximately 25 metres from the junction with Halt Robin Road. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Picardy Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Persistent unauthorised obstruction of highway near a junction, 9th February
item.description:
Traffic cones have been placed on the public highway near the junction at Sherwood Close entrance, DA5 3EB. These cones were put out in the middle of the night approximately two weeks ago and do not appear to be authorised by the council or any utility company. Since then, the person responsible has repeatedly moved the cones further into the carriageway and has now started placing cones on the opposite side of the road as well, significantly reducing available road space and causing the junction to become dangerous due to limited space either side of the road. The cones are being used to block public parking and restrict access and are regularly replaced after being moved. As this is at/near a junction, it is becoming a potential safety hazard and an ongoing obstruction of the public highway. Please could this be investigated urgently and the cones removed, and appropriate enforcement action taken if necessary.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sherwood Close, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pot holes, 9th February
item.description:
Huge potholes outside the houses on Christchurch way between 81 and 83. They so bad I have rolled my ankle twice just getting out of the car. I am a disabled driver and therefore unable to park elsewhere due to my mobility. I am extremely careful when getting out the car but itâ€™s pretty much unavoidable. Someone will end up really getting hurt.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Way, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Various Items flytipped, 9th February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): John Wilson Street, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet
